definition[0]: if a product is price-sensitive, its sales are affected by the price
example[0]: Gasoline is a very price-sensitive product - people will drive for long distances to get a few cents off.
example[1]: Jewelry demand is price-sensitive. When the price of gold jewelry rises by 1%, the quantity demanded falls by 2.6%.
definition[1]: a price-sensitive customer is influenced by the price of a product when choosing whether or not to buy it
example[2]: Price-sensitive customers tend to be disloyal when prices increase.
definition[2]: price-sensitive information is likely to affect prices if it becomes known, especially share prices
example[3]: Employees with access to price-sensitive information are prohibited from disclosing this information to outsiders.
